newsitem.title: JAPAN: E.Asia Oilseeds - Japan buys beans for July shipment.
newsitem.headline: E.Asia Oilseeds - Japan buys beans for July shipment.

text.p: Japanese buyers will pick up U.S. soybeans for July shipment this week due to firmer quotes seen on U.S. Gulf/Japan freight rates, traders said on Monday. "End-users returned to the market since last week and are watching the freight cost across the Pacific Ocean," a soybean trader at a major trade house in Japan said.
Freight rates for nearby shipments on the U.S. Gulf/Japan route for Panamax-sized vessels were quoted at US$21.50 a tonne against around $21.25 last week, traders said.
Another factor which will determine any further buying from the Japanese will be talks on soymeal prices for the July to September period between crushers and feed makers, traders said.
"Given the firmer Chicago market, we're suggesting crushers buy at a quicker pace. But the uncertainty of the soymeal price talks makes them hesitant to buy," another soybean trader in Japan said.
South Korean buyers of soybean, however, will probably remain inactive this week due to high prices, traders said.
"The prices are too high," said one trader in Korea, where he said buyer swere waiting for easier prices in the market.
Dealers said the local soybean market was also awaiting a U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) report due out later on Monday before deciding which way to move.
"Buyers will stay uninterested for the time being if the USDA report proves to be bullish," the trader said.
